item.title: [HIVE-28616] OrcReader is not closed in OrcEncodedDataReader
item.description:
https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/1789f931377c94641aa530d38a6048e54cbfd12d/llap-server/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/llap/io/encoded/OrcEncodedDataReader.java#L556
OrcEncodedDataReader fully owns the OrcReader instance it creates, so it should be closed there too

it was discovered and fixed on a cluster by harishjp
item.summary: OrcReader is not closed in OrcEncodedDataReader

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Context, these are the observed stacktrace where connections were not released.

There are 2 stack traces where we saw the connections in the pool were leased but not released back:

This one is for orcReader instance which will be fixed with cleanupReader closing orcReader.

This is for rawDataReader which will be fixed by setting isRawDataReaderOpen to true (closed later in cleanupReaders). FYI, this open is a lazy call and only really opens connection during the read, but we could trace back the objects to be created at this trace.
